name: Le Royal Mansour Meridien

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though our room was quite large and nice- it was a huge rip-off. Not only was wifi outrageous, but the room and drinks were ridiculous- 200 dirhams for a rhum and coke! As well, when we left, they charged us some thing called promotional taxes 99 dirhams a night- when I asked what it was- they said it was a city tax. This is totally untrue as the city tax is 5 dirhams per night. They basically added $15 a night to our room. Avoid this place at all costs. There are much better and more honest places to stay.
reviews.title: Nice Room- Big Rip-Off

reviews.text: i stayed for 7 nights in this hotel, the rooms are clean with some outdated items. the hotel facilities are old and average.
reviews.title: Good stay in good room

reviews.text: The SPA is very basic and doesn't stand for the price, so i recommend you try outside.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
Expected more
reviews.text: the rooms have no view, so don't worry about which room you will get.
the hotel team is very friendly and supportive, also they always welcome you with a smile :)
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in the heart of casablanca
How stars vary from Europe to Africa
reviews.text: The whole stay was good but not what you expect from a "Meridien" hotel,overpriced for what it offers. Big rooms but not renovated,acceptably cleaned.Food not acceptable,very european cuisine,very few traditional dishes.Service good but not professional with respect to the bufee..the waiters were served themselves by the bufee while serving customers(!).

reviews.title: 5 Star Staff Seeks Better Facilities
reviews.text: Past the excellent, friendly and very accommodating staff, and beyond the exquisite lobby, you reach your room. And that is where things go downhill.

reviews.title: Tired Old Dame
reviews.text: We had two rooms on the "Preferred Guest" floor both with the same issues. To begin, the rooms were hot - 80 degrees F while it was low 60s F outside. Turning the room fan on produced noise but no discernible air movement and certainly no temperature reduction. The somewhat complex room thermostat clearly didn't work. Opening the window -- barely, due to a safety lock - you enjoy the diesel fumes, traffic sounds, and the constant car horns of Casablanca, but the room did begin to cool- but only a few degrees. The bed is modestly comfortable, with a mattress with a few lumps and bumps, along with very thick and very hard pillows that leave your head elevated well above your body and with difficulty in finding any comfortable position.

reviews.title: Good hotel with excellent service
reviews.text: The real horror story was the bathroom ( see pictures). The mold on the tub and shower surround was clearly visible nearly everywhere you looked to the point of genuine concern about mold spores in the air. Calling the state of the tub shabby would be charitable, including dark stains and cracks near the top of the tub. The obviously clogged tub drains in both rooms left you standing in nearly knee-deep water by the end of your shower. Perhaps this is their method of keeping showers brief.

reviews.title: Beware at check out. Unprofessional staff. Special note for Canadian travelers.
reviews.text: The room itself is spacious but clearly has seen better days, with chips in the moldings and fading paint. The bedroom did appear clean. There was also apparently some construction on the floor above, and so for the first few hours of our stay we had a nearly constant and very loud banging.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is in DIRE need of refurbishment. The location is good and the "bones" of the building has great potential but the actual rooms sours the name of what should be a top brand.
reviews.title: Le Meridien/Starwood....are you listening?

reviews.text: The staff is friendly and attentive. Communication directly with the hotel prior to our stay was helpful. We stayed 2 nights and it appeared that every person we came into contact with truly wanted to make sure our stay was a good one.
reviews.title: Choose another hotel for your stay.

reviews.text: Our room was very large but I am not sure why were were not assigned one on the SPG according to our status. Maybe those rooms would have given us a better impression. I peaked at the gym and Hammam which look nice.
reviews.title: High price to pay for pealing paint...

reviews.text: Everything in the guest room was clean but old, dark and dank with an unpleasant smell. The toilet, sink and the tub were all cracked. Lighting was horrible. Towels were rough and old. The air conditioning was not sufficient.
reviews.title: Old is not gold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very nice with lots of healthy offerings but yes, very expensive. And in this day and age, fees should not be charged for internet in the room, especially for loyalty program members.
reviews.title: Comfortable Room, Good Food

reviews.text: This large 5 star hotel in the center of Casablanca sometimes offers great large, luxury and quiet rooms, almost small apartments, for a very reasonable price. Rooms are really wonderful, large with huge bathrooms and spotless clean!
reviews.title: Great rooms for good price. But all the rest is rather pricey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff is also friendly and very helpful. So far so good.
reviews.title: Royal Grill restaurant - Excellent food - not so good prices

reviews.text: The issue is that all other amenities are quite pricey. Like the dinner, breakfast even internet. And except for the rooms the hotel has not much to offer. At least not included. I also didn´t find any options like gym or pool or maybe I didn´t search enough for it.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: So one option to keep the spending down is to have local breakfast in the local cafe around the corner. Dinner and lunch elsewhere too and buy an internet 3G usb dongle from a local operator.
reviews.title: Stylish Hotel near to Medina

reviews.text: Also the main restaurant, even it´s stylish, lacks a comfortable atmosphere in my opinion. Quality of the food is good though. There is a second restaurant offering local Morocco food. The restaurant is decorated like a desert-tent. But also here prices high. So an option can be to go outside and dine at a 'real' Morocco restaurant, for 'real' Morocco prices. But that will take some time as there do not seem to be many restaurants around.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

aka: Le Royal Mansour Meridien Hotel Casablanca
description: Le Royal Mansour Méridien offers deluxe service and limitless possibilities for discovery, just a few minutes from the Corniche of Casablanca and the Hassan II mosque. The hotel features 182 sophisticated guestrooms including 23 suites, all known for their historical elegance and modern comfort.
